newsitem.title: GERMANY: SOCCER-COACH HAS HEART ATTACK DURING FIRST TRAINING SESSION.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-COACH HAS HEART ATTACK DURING FIRST TRAINING SESSION.

text.p: Heinz Hoeher, new coach of struggling German second division side VfB Luebeck, suffered a heart attack at his first training session on Thursday, the club said.
Shortly after being presented to the media as sacked trainer Michael Lorkowski's replacement, Hoeher, 58, was taken ill on the training pitch.
He was taken to a nearby hospital in the north German port.
Last week Dieter Fischdick, chairman of first division Duisburg, died after suffering a heart attack at a news conference. He was also 58.
